intro: Urera trinervis, commonly known as the creeping urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that have three nerves, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties have made it of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
